column4: how to scan all the iso files in a folder using clamscan in one command?
in one command?  you can mount an iso file like any files system with loop and you can clmascan that
i have 3 iso files in one folder. so dont want to do three clamscan commands. so can i scan that 3 iso in only one command?
you can write a script to do it with one command but you will need to mount the iso files http://hacktivision.com/index.php/2008/02/24/how-to-mount-iso-images-in-ubuntu-the-ea?blog=2
while using mount command it says that only root can do that. cant i do it in non sudo user?
you can add the user to allow mounting file systems
